main event: On 12 December 1952, a luminous, cigar-shaped object was observed leaving a trail of sparks over Los Alamos, New Mexico.
interesting points: The object was seen for about 3 seconds before disappearing suddenly., The object traveled in a fanlike maneuver at an altitude of approximately 600 - 800 feet., The speed of the object was estimated at 600 - 800 mph with no sound emitted., Witness indicated the object was round, white, approximately 20 - 25 feet in diameter., Several different reports for sightings of UFOs were associated with the same location and timeframe.
sighted object: a round, bright luminous, cigar-white object
witness description: Security investigator, Grande Derry, employed at the Atomic Energy Commission
